gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - Hg Particulate from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Particulate total mercury and monomethylmercury - US GEOTRACES NATZ Dataset Description: <p>Particulate total mercury and monomethylmercury across the US GEOTRACES North Atlantic Zonal Section.</p><p>This dataset includes concentrations of particulate total mercury and particulate monomethylmercury from surface water to bottom water at 22 stations across the cruise path. Particle samples were collected with a multiple-unit large-volume in situ filtration system that collected a size fraction between 1 and 51 um.</p> Acquisition Description: <p>- Sample collection: Bishop et al., 2012.&nbsp; Samples were collected from the surface at 30 meters to the ocean floor, as deep as 5800 meters. Approximately 16 depths were sampled at each station.&nbsp; Used the ODF Niskin rosette.</p><p>- Particulate samples were frozen and transported to Wright State University (Dayton, OH) where they were analyzed within 3 months of collection. Filter punches were digested in acid-cleaned polypropylene containers with 8 mL of 2N HNO3 (Baker Instra-Analyzed).&nbsp; After analysis of MMHg, an aliquot of digestate was oxidized with BrCl solution for total Hg determination: Hammerschmidt &amp; Fitzgerald, 2006.</p><p>- HgT analysis: <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fitzgerald &amp; Gill, 1979; Bloom &amp; Fitzgerald, 1988; Bloom, 1989<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detection limit: 0.03 pM<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Procedural duplicates: 3 &plusmn; 3 relative percent difference (n=18)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Recovery of known additions: 106% recovery (n=1)</p><p>-MMHg analysis: <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tseng et al., 2004<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detection limit: 2 fM<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Filter digestates contained insufficient analyte for analysis of either procedural duplicates or recovery of known additions. Particulate MMHg concentrations were &lt; 4 fM and required the maximum amount of sample volume to obtain a signal.</p>

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32193.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32194.rdf Name: cruise_part Units: text Description: identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts: For KN204-01: part A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)part B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32195.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sta', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32196.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sample', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32197.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: latitude; north is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32198.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: longitude; east is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32199.rdf Name: depth_n Units: meters Description: nominal sample depth; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32200.rdf Name: Hg_total Units: picomoles/liter Description: concentration of total mercury http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32201.rdf Name: Hg_total_flag Units: integer Description: total mercury quality flag:2) ok3) questionable4) bad analysis5) sample lost6) mean of replicates9) sample was not collected for Hg analysis http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32202.rdf Name: MMHg Units: femtomoles/liter Description: concentration of monomethylmercury http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32203.rdf Name: MMHg_flag Units: integer Description: monomethylmercury quality flag:2) ok3) questionable4) bad analysis5) sample lost6) mean of replicates http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32204.rdf Name: comment Units: unknown Description: comment pertaining to sample. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33152.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33153.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33154.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33155.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33156.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33157.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts: For KN204-01: part A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda)part B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia, Cabo Verde); General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sta', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sample', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: latitude; north is positive; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: longitude; east is positive; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: nominal sample depth; provided in original data submission.; General Description: depth; nominal

PI-supplied Description: concentration of total mercury; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: total mercury quality flag:2) ok3) questionable4) bad analysis5) sample lost6) mean of replicates9) sample was not collected for Hg analysis; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: concentration of monomethylmercury; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: monomethylmercury quality flag:2) ok3) questionable4) bad analysis5) sample lost6) mean of replicates; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: comment pertaining to sample.; General Description: free text comments, may only have meaning to submitting PI

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>- Sample collection: Bishop et al., 2012.&nbsp; Samples were collected from the surface at 30 meters to the ocean floor, as deep as 5800 meters. Approximately 16 depths were sampled at each station.&nbsp; Used the ODF Niskin rosette.</p><p>- Particulate samples were frozen and transported to Wright State University (Dayton, OH) where they were analyzed within 3 months of collection. Filter punches were digested in acid-cleaned polypropylene containers with 8 mL of 2N HNO3 (Baker Instra-Analyzed).&nbsp; After analysis of MMHg, an aliquot of digestate was oxidized with BrCl solution for total Hg determination: Hammerschmidt &amp; Fitzgerald, 2006.</p><p>- HgT analysis: <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fitzgerald &amp; Gill, 1979; Bloom &amp; Fitzgerald, 1988; Bloom, 1989<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detection limit: 0.03 pM<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Procedural duplicates: 3 &plusmn; 3 relative percent difference (n=18)<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Recovery of known additions: 106% recovery (n=1)</p><p>-MMHg analysis: <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tseng et al., 2004<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detection limit: 2 fM<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Filter digestates contained insufficient analyte for analysis of either procedural duplicates or recovery of known additions. Particulate MMHg concentrations were &lt; 4 fM and required the maximum amount of sample volume to obtain a signal.</p>

<p>&quot;lt_DL&quot; indicates that a sample was below the method detection limit.<br />Sample volumes were used to calculate either picomolar or femtomolar concentrations of different mercury species.</p><p><b>Related files and references:&nbsp; </b><br /><br />Bishop, J.K.B., Lam, P.J., Wood, T.J. 2012. Getting good particles: Accurate sampling of particles by large volume in-situ filtration.<br /><br />Bloom, N. 1989. Determination of picogram levels of methylmercury by aqueous phase ethylation, followed by cryogenic gas-chromatography with cold vapor atomic fluorescence detection. Can. J. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 46, 1131-1140.<br /><br />Bloom, N.S., Fitzgerald, W.F. 1988. Determination of volatile mercury species at the picogram level by low-temperature gas chromatography with cold-vapor atomic fluorescence detection. Anal. Chim Acta 208, 151-161.<br /><br />Fitzgerald, W.F., Gill, G.A. 1979. Subnanogram determination of mercury by two-stage gold amalgamation applied to atmospheric analysis. Anal. Chem. 51, 1714-1720.<br /><br />Hammerschmidt, C.R., Fitzgerald, W. F.&nbsp; 2006.&nbsp; Bioaccumulation and trophic transfer of methylmercury in Long Island Sound. Arch. Environ. Contam. Toxicol. 51, 416-424.<br /><br />Tseng, C.-M., Hammerschmidt, C.R., Fitzgerald, W.F. 2004. Determination of methylmercury in environmental matrixes by on-line flow injection and atomic fluorescence spectrometry. Anal. Chem. 76, 7131-7136.</p><p><b>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</b><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called &quot;join&quot;) was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters. <br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Trace Metal Bottle PI Supplied Instrument Description:ODF (Scripps Ocean Data Facility) rosette with twelve 30-liter Niskin bottles Instrument Name: Trace Metal Bottle Instrument Short Name:TM Bottle Instrument Description: Trace metal (TM) clean rosette bottle used for collecting trace metal clean seawater samples. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: McLane Pump Instrument Name: McLane Pump Instrument Short Name:McLane Pump Instrument Description: McLane pumps sample large volumes of seawater at depth. They are attached to a wire and lowered to different depths in the ocean. As the water is pumped through the filter, particles suspended in the ocean are collected on the filters. The pumps are then retrieved and the contents of the filters are analyzed in a lab.

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Cold Vapor Atomic Fluorescence Spectrophotometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Tekran Model 2500 CVAFS Mercury Detector Instrument Name: Cold Vapor Atomic Fluorescence Spectrophotometer Instrument Short Name:CVAFS Instrument Description: A Cold Vapor Atomic Fluorescent Spectrophotometer (CVAFS) is an instrument used for quantitative determination of volatile heavy metals, such as mercury. CVAFS make use of the characteristic of mercury that allows vapor measurement at room temperature. Mercury atoms in an inert carrier gas are excited by a collimated UV light source at a particular wavelength. As the atoms return to their non-excited state they re-radiate their absorbed energy at the same wavelength. The fluorescence may be detected using a photomultiplier tube or UV photodiode.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
